alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 4:47PM ChST until August 08 at 5:45PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tiyan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Guam... * Until 545 PM ChST. * At 441 PM ChST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.6 and 1.4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.8 to 2.6 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dededo, Tamuning, Yigo and Andersen AFB. Corrected to remove flash flooding is already occurring statement FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
